Question.Question: What is the core networking service provided by Google on Google Cloud Platform?
Answers: Virtual Private Cloud

Question.Question: What is the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) on Google Cloud Platform?
Options: Virtualized network within Google Cloud
A global resource
A dedicated physical network exclusive to one region
A dedicated physical network exclusive to one zone
Answers: Virtual Private Cloud

Question.Question: What are the characteristics of the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) on Google Cloud Platform?
Options: Each VPC contains a default network
Additional networks can be created in your projects, but networks cannot be shared between projects
Additional networks can be created in your projects and networks can be shared between projects
VPCs are limited to a single region
Answers: Each VPC contains a default network
Additional networks can be created in your projects, but networks cannot be shared between projects

Question.Question: What are two other networking services available on Google Cloud Platform?
Answers: Firewall Rules
Routes

Question.Question: What do Firewall Rules do on Google Cloud Platform?
Options: Govern traffic coming into instances on a network
Automatically encrypt all network traffic
Backup data to Google Cloud Storage
Monitor application performance
Answers: Govern traffic coming into instances on a network

Question.Question: What are the characteristics of Firewall Rules on Google Cloud Platform?
Options: Default network has a default set of firewall rules
Custom rules can be created
Firewall rules cannot be modified once created
Firewall rules only apply to outbound traffic
Answers: Default network has a default set of firewall rules
Custom rules can be created

Question.Question: Routes on Google Cloud Platform specify how packets leaving an instance should be directed (i.e. defining which way your traffic is going to travel). [T/F]?
Answers: F

Question.Question: What are characteristics of Routes on Google Cloud Platform?
Options: Advanced networking functions for your instances
Define DNS settings for your instances
Specify firewall rules for traffic filtering
Allocate IP addresses to your instances
Answers: Advanced networking functions for your instances

Question.Question: What are the two load-balancing methods available on Google Cloud Platform?
Answers: HTTP(S) Load Balancing
Network Load Balancing

Question.Question: Which load balancing method is locked to a single region?
Answers: Network Load Balancing

Question.Question: Which load balancing method is capable of world-wide autoscaling / load-balancing for more than 1 region?
Answers: HTTP(S) Load Balancing

Question.Question: How can HTTP(S) Load Balancing be used for a single region?
Options: By utilizing a single global IP
By using multiple regional IPs
By configuring a local load balancer
By enabling cross-region routing
Answers: By utilizing a single global IP

Question.Question: What are the characteristics of HTTP(S) Load Balancing on Google Cloud Platform?
Options: Distribute traffic based on content type
Distribute traffic across regions to ensure that requests are routed to the closest region, or in the event of a failure or over-capacity, to a healthy instance in the next closest region
Limited to regional traffic distribution
Cannot route traffic based on content type
Answers: Distribute traffic based on content type
Distribute traffic across regions to ensure that requests are routed to the closest region, or in the event of a failure or over-capacity, to a healthy instance in the next closest region

Question.Question: What is Google Cloud DNS do on Google Cloud Platform?
Options: Publish and maintain DNS records by using the same infrastructure that Google uses
Manage IP addresses for virtual machines
Provide DDoS protection for applications
Enable load balancing for applications
Answers: Publish and maintain DNS records by using the same infrastructure that Google uses

Question.Question: What are characteristics of Google Cloud DNS on Google Cloud Platform?
Options: Work with managed zones and DNS records through the Cloud CLI
Work with managed zones and DNS records through the Cloud API
Work with managed zones and DNS records through the Cloud SDK
Manage virtual machines through the Cloud DNS
Answers: Work with managed zones and DNS records through the Cloud CLI
Work with managed zones and DNS records through the Cloud API
Work with managed zones and DNS records through the Cloud SDK

Question.Question: At a high-level, what is Cloud VPN used for on Google Cloud Platform?
Options: Connecting an existing network to your VPC through an IPsec connection
Providing a private IP address to virtual machines
Enabling multi-factor authentication for users
Monitoring network traffic for anomalies
Answers: Connecting an existing network to your VPC through an IPsec connection

Question.Question: How does Cloud VPN benefit the user on Google Cloud Platform?
Options: All data moving through the VPN is encrypted
Provides high availability for applications.
Offers load balancing capabilities.
Automates the deployment of applications.
Answers: All data moving through the VPN is encrypted

Question.Question: What is Direct Interconnect used for on Google Cloud Platform?
Options: Connecting an existing network to your VPC using a highly available, low-latency, enterprise-grade connection
Providing a VPN connection for remote users
Monitoring application performance
Managing DNS records for domains
Answers: Connecting an existing network to your VPC using a highly available, low-latency, enterprise-grade connection

Question.Question: What are the differences between Cloud VPN and Direct Interconnect?
Options: Cloud VPN allows the connection to traverse the open internet, whereas Direct Interconnect connects to Google's private Internet back-bone
Cloud VPN provides higher latency than Direct Interconnect
Direct Interconnect is limited to a single region, whereas Cloud VPN can span multiple regions
Cloud VPN requires manual configuration, while Direct Interconnect is fully automated
Answers: Cloud VPN allows the connection to traverse the open internet, whereas Direct Interconnect connects to Google's private Internet back-bone

Question.Question: What is the Direct Peering connectivity option on Google Cloud Platform?
Options: Exchange internet traffic between your business network and Google at one of Google's broad-reaching edge network locations
Monitor network traffic for security threats
Provide DNS services for your domain
Enable multi-factor authentication for users
Answers: Exchange internet traffic between your business network and Google at one of Google's broad-reaching edge network locations

Question.Question: What is the Carrier Peering connectivity option on Google Cloud Platform?
Options: Connect your infrastructure to Google's network edge through highly available, lower-latency connections by using service providers
Provide load balancing for your applications
Manage DNS records for your domains
Monitor application performance
Answers: Connect your infrastructure to Google's network edge through highly available, lower-latency connections by using service providers
